purpleculture_pinyin:
jīng
classics; sacred book; scripture; to pass through; to undergo; to bear; to endure; warp (textile); longitude; menstruation; channel (TCM); abbr. for economics 经济
классика; священная книга; писание; пройти; пройти; нести; терпеть; основа (текстильная); долгота; менструация; канал (TCM); сокр. по экономике 经济
rtega_mnemonic:
經經RS
经经		経classic works, warp of a fabric, things running lengthwise, rules, regulations, plan, rule, arrange, pass through, stand, longitude
  • streams under ground 巠 passing through the bedrock like a thread 糸 passing through a bound book with classic works, plans or regulations
  • ⓢ a thread 纟binding a crafted 工 book by entering 入 it
  • holy 圣 silk 糸 cloth with sutras: reading them one passes through various stages of enlightenment
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 经)
Antonyms: 緯
Pictophonetic: 巠 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.

經常 [ jīng cháng ]: frequently; constantly; regularly; often; day-to-day; everyday; daily

heisig_chinese_memo: Spiderman keeps his collection of ancient scriptures wrapped up in a spool for safe keeping.
Ru_trainchinese:
jīng: (глаг) проходить через; испытывать
jīng: (графема) сутра, каноническая книга; неизменное правило; менструация, месячные; (кит. мед.) каналы; (геогр.) долгота
jīng: (графема) постоянный, стабильный; править, управлять, заниматься; выдерживать, терпеть; (букв.) повеситься
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The holy but old scriptures started to fall apart so we had to mend them with a spool of thread.
origin_of_ch_char_book: (經, 经, jing, pass; channel) There is a thread on the left. On the right, there are many strands of the thread hanging on the tree , and there is a big loom underneath for weaving. When threads are woven together, then it becomes a fabric. It is now used to mean a ‘pass’, or ‘economy’. (布, bu, cloth) A hand takes a long tool, and the fabric is rolled up. Someone is flattening a piece of cloth with a bat. It is used as the meaning of ‘fabric’ and ‘flatten’. (市, shi, city; market) This character meant ‘to stop’ 止 (zhi=chih, stop). Below is the roll of cloth, for making clothes. Textiles were an important trading item. This cloth is sold in specific locations, at a ‘market’ or in a ‘city’. Looking at the character (衣, yi, clothing) which means a garment, we can easily discern two sleeves on both sides. One side of the collar is folded over the other. This character is applied in other characters. For example, (依, yi, to depend on) is a combination of a garment (衣, yi) and a person who is wearing the garment. He needs to protect himself from the wind, sun, and cold with clothes. Clothes were precious and people treasured their clothes. Therefore, the symbol evolved to “to depend on”.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from "糸", "巠" also sound. The "巠" is like the longitudinal warp on a loom, opposite the horizontal weft. The latitude and longitude of later geography is also justified by this. " Jing " also guides northbound roads, extending to indicate passing, passing, and experiencing. In Chinese medicine, the "meridian" is the main pathway for the circulation of qi and blood in the human body, and it is the straight line of the meridian system. Extending from the main channel, " Sutra " also refers to the common way, common sense, and common law, so it is also used to honor model works and religious classics, such as "Thirteen Classics", four books and five classics, Buddhist scriptures, etc. By extension, there is a constant meaning.

Jin Wen means to follow and practice (Jin Guotai, Zhang Shichao), Qi Chen Manxun: "Zhao Jin (Diligence) Jingde" means diligently pursuing morality. That is to say that virtue is the classics, and everything is based on virtue (Wang Wenyao). It also means to imitate the uncle clock: "Yu Jing is the Xianqi (ancestor)", which means that I imitate your ancestor (Guo Moruo).

The bamboo slips of the Warring States period indicate the warp, "Shangbo Bamboo Book III. "Peng Zu" Jane 2: "Talking about the world and people, if the warp and weft, if the surface and the inside." It also expresses the common law and the law, "Shangbo Bamboo Book IV. "Neifeng" Jane 10: "The gentleman said: "Zi (悌), the classics of the people." It means that Ti (the virtue of respecting and loving brothers) is the law followed by the people. It is also known as " path " (Shen Pei), "Shangbo Bamboo Book Five. "Gucheng Family Father" Jane 7: "I plant (upright) stand by (path), and think about what is behind the picture." It means that I stand upright, act with integrity (that is, be honest), think deeply and plan for the future. It is also known as " Jing ", referring to Jingshui, "Shangbo Zhushu II. "Rong Chengshi" Jane 27: "Yu is the Jing (Jing) and Wei, the river of Bei Ma (Note), so it is almost 𠭯 The state can only be at the place." It means that Dayu then dredged the Jingshui. He Wei River flows into the Yellow River from the north, so the state can be lived in from the beginning.

"Shuowen": "Jing, weaving. Congshi, 巠声." Duan Yucai's note: "In ancient times, horizontal and straight is Heng Cong. "Mao Shi" says: "Heng Cong Qi Mu" is also. , Later generations arbitrarily replace it." "The weaving from silk means the warp. There must be warp first and then weft. It is the constant scripture of the heaven and earth called the three outlines, five constants and six arts. Said Wei." Yi Xu Yun "twisted, hanged." "Hanged, the warp." What is the meaning of death by hanging? It means death in Shengzhi County. The extension of the meaning of silk is also.
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from "糸" from "巠" to "巠", "巠" in addition to the vertical silk thread on a textile machine is also a sound symbol. The original meaning is vertical silk thread. Contrast with " wei ".
humanum_full_description:
金文從「糸」，「巠」亦聲。「巠」象織布機上的縱向的經線，與橫向的緯線相對。後世地理學的經緯度，亦由此而得義。「經」又指南北向的道路，引申表示經過、途經、經歷。在中醫學裏，「經脈」是人體內氣血運行的主要通路，是經絡系統中直行的幹線。由主要通路引申，「經」又指常道、常理、常法，故又用來尊稱典範著作及宗教典籍，如《十三經》、四書五經、佛經等。再引申之，又有經常之義。

　　金文表示奉行、實踐（金國泰、張世超），齊陳曼簠：「肇堇（勤）經德」，意謂勤奮奉行道德。即是說以德為經，一切以德作為標準（王文耀）。又表示效法，叔尸鐘：「余經乃先且（祖）」，意謂我效法你的先祖（郭沫若）。

　　戰國竹簡表示經線，《上博竹書三．彭祖》簡2：「言天地與人，若經與緯，若表與裏。」又表示常法、法則，《上博竹書四．內豊》簡10：「君子曰：俤（悌），民之經也。」意謂悌（指敬愛兄長之德）是人民遵循的法則。又通假為「徑」（沈培），《上博竹書五．姑成家父》簡7：「吾植（直）立經（徑）行，遠慮圖後。」意謂我立身正直，秉性行事（即處事率真），計慮深遠，策劃未來。又通假為「涇」，指涇水，《上博竹書二．容成氏》簡27：「禹乃迵（通）經（涇）與渭，北䜴（注）之河，於是乎𠭯州始可凥（處）也。」意謂大禹於是疏通涇水和渭水，從北面流入黃河，於是𠭯州從始可以居住。

　　《說文》：「經，織也。从糸，巠聲。」段玉裁注：「古謂橫直爲衡從。《毛詩》云：『衡從其畝』是也。字本不作縱，後人妄以代之。」「織之從絲謂之經。必先有經而後有緯。是故三綱五常六藝謂之天地之常經。《大戴禮》曰：『南北曰經，東西曰緯。』抑許云『絞，縊也。』『縊，經也。』縊死何言經死也？謂以繩直縣而死。從絲之義之引申也。」
humanum_short_description: 金文從「糸」從「巠」，「巠」除象紡織機上的垂直的絲線外，亦是聲符。本義是垂直的絲線。與「緯」相對。

經經RS
经经 		経 classic works, warp of a fabric, things running lengthwise, rules, regulations, plan, rule, arrange, pass through, stand, longitude
  • streams under ground 巠 passing through the bedrock like a thread 糸 passing through a bound book with classic works, plans or regulations
  • ⓢ a thread 纟binding a crafted 工 book by entering 入 it
  • holy 圣 silk 糸 cloth with sutras: reading them one passes through various stages of enlightenment
(Simplified: 经)
Chinese Definition: Antonyms: 緯
Pictophonetic: 巠 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 巠 [ jīng ] underground river; flowing water
①織布時用梭穿織的豎紗，編織物的縱線，與“緯”相對：經紗。經線。經綸(a。整理過的蠶絲；b。喻政治規劃)。
②地理學上指通過南北極與赤道成直角的線(亦作“子午線”)：東經。西經。經度。經緯儀。
③作爲思想、道德、行爲等標準的書，亦稱宗教中講教義的書，或稱某一方面事物的專著：詩經。易經。經書。經卷。經文。經義。經傳(zhuàn)(儒家經典與註疏的合稱)。四書五經。經史子集。黃帝內經。
④治理，管理：經理。經營。經商。經濟。經紀。經天緯地。
⑤通過：經過。經歷。經驗。經手。經辦。經年累月。經久不息。
⑥禁受：經受。經風雨，見世面。
⑦常行的，歷史不變的：經常。經費。荒誕不經。
⑧中醫指人體內較大的脈絡：經脈。經絡。
⑨表示動作的時間而且完成了：已經。曾經。
⑩縊死，上吊：自經。
⑾婦女每月一次由陰道排出血液：月經。經血。
⑿古同“京”，數目。
⒀姓氏。

經常 [ jīng cháng ]: frequently; constantly; regularly; often; day-to-day; everyday; daily
經營 [ jīng yíng ]: to engage in (business etc); to run; to operate

經字的基本解释

經
jīng
见“经”。

經字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jīng］
［《廣韻》古靈切，平青，見。］
［《廣韻》古定切，去徑，見。］
“坕1”的今字。亦作“巠1”。“经1”的繁体字。
(1)织物的纵线。与“緯”相对。
(2)南北向的道路或土地。
(3)今称地理学上假设通过地球南北极与赤道垂直的东西分度线为经。参见“經度”。
(4)常道。指常行的义理、准则、法制。
(5)正常；经常。
(6)对典范著作及宗教典籍的尊称。如《十三经》、佛经等。
(7)指记述某一事物、技艺的权威性专书。如《山海经》、《本草经》、《茶经》等。
(8)量度；筹划。
(9)划分界限。
(10)治理；管理。
(11)循行；经过；经历。
(12)引申为经受，承受。
(13)系缢；悬吊。
(14)人体经脉的简称。
(15)指妇女的月经。
(16)古数名。
(17)酒器名。
(18)曾，已。
(19)姓。晋代有经旷。见《通志·氏族五》。
[②]［jìng］
［《廣韻》古定切，去徑，見。］
“坕2”的今字。“经2”的繁体字。<

經字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　經； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页925第24
〔古文〕?坕【唐韻】【廣韻】古靈切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】堅靈切，?音涇。【說文】織也。【玉篇】經緯，以成繒帛也。【易·屯卦】君子以經綸。【疏】經，謂經緯。　又【易·頤卦】拂經於丘。【註】經猶義也。　又【書·酒誥】經德秉哲。【傳】能常德持智。【左傳·昭二十五年】夫禮，天之經也。【註】經者，道之常。　又【詩·大雅】經之營之。【傳】經，度之也。　又【周禮·天官·冢宰】體國經野。【註】經，謂爲之里。【疏】南北之道謂之經，東西之道謂之緯。　又【周禮·天官·大宰】以經邦國。【註】經，法也。王謂之禮經常所秉以治天下者也。　又【禮·月令】毋失經紀。【註】謂天文進退度數。又【禮·經解疏】經解者，以其記六藝政敎之得失也。　又【左傳·昭二十五年】爲夫婦外內，以經二物。【註】夫治外，婦治內，各治其物。　又【論語】自經於溝瀆，而莫之知也。【何晏註】經，經死於溝瀆之中。【晉語】雉經於新城廟。【釋名】屈頸閉氣曰雉經，如雉之爲也。　又【廣韻】古定切，音徑。經緯也。又織也。　又

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jīng］
["Guangyun" Gu Lingqie, Pingqing, see. ]
["Guangyun" ancient fixed cut, go to the path, see. ]
The present character of "坕1". Also known as "巠1". Traditional characters of "经1".
(1) The longitudinal threads of the fabric. Contrast with "latitude".
(2) North-south roads or land.
(3) Nowadays, in geography, it is assumed that the east-west dividing line that passes through the north and south poles of the earth and is perpendicular to the equator is the longitude. See "longitude".
(4) Changdao. Refers to the usual principles, norms, and legal systems.
(5) Normal; often.
(6) The honorific title of model works and religious classics. Such as "Thirteen Sutras", Buddhist scriptures and so on.
(7) Refers to an authoritative book describing a certain thing and skill. Such as "Shanhaijing", "Materia Medica", "Tea Classic" and so on.
(8) Measurement; planning.
(9) Divide boundaries.
(10) Governance; management.
(11) Follow; go through; experience.
(12) The extension is to endure and bear.
(13) Hanging; hanging.
(14) Abbreviation for human meridian.
(15) Refers to women's menstruation.
(16) Ancient names.
(17) The name of the wine vessel.
(18) Zeng, already.
(19) Last name. There was Jing Kuang in the Jin Dynasty. See "Tongzhi·Clan Five".
[②]［jìng］
["Guangyun" ancient fixed cut, go to the path, see. ]
The present character of "坕2". Traditional characters of "经2".
